summary.para: The CompositeImage method composites the current frames available in each input stream.

param.name: pD3DDevice
param.para: Pointer to the IUnknown interface of the Direct3D device. The compositor must cast this to a LPDIRECT3DDEVICE7 type.

param.name: pddsRenderTarget
param.para: Specifies the DirectDraw surface that all drawing should be performed on.

param.name: pmtRenderTarget
param.para: Specifies the media type of the DirectDraw surface.

param.name: pVideoStreamInfo
param.para: Pointer to an array of video stream info objects.

param.name: cStreams
param.para: Specifies the number of streams to be mixed, which is equal to the size of the pVideoStreamInfo array.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

summary.para: The InitCompositionTarget method informs the compositor that a new composition target has been created. The compositor should perform any necessary configuration work in this method. This could include attaching a Z or stencil buffer buffer for the new render target

param.name: pD3DDevice
param.para: Pointer to the IUnknown interface of the Direct3D device object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

summary.para: The SetStreamMediaType method sets the media type for the input stream.

param.name: dwStrmID
param.para: Specifies the input stream. The value must be from 1 through 16.

param.name: pmt
param.para: Pointer to an structure that specifies the media type.

param.name: fTexture
param.para: If TRUE, specifies that the target surface is a Direct3D texture surface.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

summary.para: The TermCompositionTarget method informs the compositor that the current composition target is being replaced. Compositors should perform any necessary cleanup of the composition target in this method.

param.name: pD3DDevice
param.para: Pointer to the IUnknown interface of the Direct3D device object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

summary.para: The IVMRImageCompositor interface is implemented by the default compositor for the Video Mixing Renderer Filter 7 (VMR-7). It must also be implemented by any plug-in compositor that an application provides for the VMR-7. The VMR-7 calls the methods on this interface to inform the Compositor that it should composite the incoming video frames into a single output frame. Applications do not use this interface.
For the VMR-9, use the IVMRImageCompositor9 interface.
